Device.Name: STM32WLxx
Device.Description: ARM 32-bit Cortex-M0+ and ARM 32-bit Cortex-M4 dual core based device

Peripheral.Name: Embedded Flash
Peripheral.Description: The Flash memory interface manages CPU AHB I-Code and D-Code accesses to the Flash memory. It implements the erase and program Flash memory operations and the read and write protection mechanisms

Peripheral.Name: OTP
Peripheral.Description: The Data OTP memory block. It contains the one time programmable bits.

Peripheral.Name: MirrorOptionBytes
Peripheral.Description: Mirror Option Bytes contains the extra area.

Bit.Name: RDP
Bit.Description: Read protection option byte. The read protection is used to protect the software code stored in Flash memory.

Values.Val: Level 0, no protection
or any value other than 0xAA and 0xCC: Level 1, read protection
Level 2, chip protection

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: These bits contain the supply level threshold that activates/releases the reset. They can be written to program a new BOR level value into Flash memory

Values.Val: BOR Level 0 reset level threshold is around 1.7 V
BOR Level 1 reset level threshold is around 2.0 V
BOR Level 2 reset level threshold is around 2.2 V
BOR Level 3 reset level threshold is around 2.5 V
BOR Level 4 reset level threshold is around 2.8 V
nBOOT0=0
nBOOT0=1

Bit.Name: nBOOT1
Bit.Description: Together with the BOOT0 pin or option bit nBOOT0, this bit selects boot mode from the user Flash memory, SRAM1 or system Flash memory . Refer to Reference Manual: Boot configuration Section.

Values.Val: BOOT0 taken from the option bit nBOOT0
BOOT0 taken from PH3/BOOT0 pin
SRAM1 and SRAM2 are erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM1 and SRAM2 are not erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM2 parity check enable
SRAM2 parity check disable
Reset generated when entering the Stop mode
No reset generated when entering the Stop mode
Reset generated when entering the Standby mode
No reset generated when entering the Standby mode
Reset generated when entering the Shutdown mode
No reset generated when entering the Shutdown mode
Hardware window watchdog
Software window watchdog
Independent watchdog counter frozen in Standby mode
Independent watchdog counter running in Standby mode
Independent watchdog counter frozen in Stop mode
Independent watchdog counter running in Stop mode
Hardware independent watchdog
Software independent watchdog
CPU1 CM4 Boot lock disabled
CPU1 CM4 Boot lock enabled
CPU2 CM0+ Boot lock disabled
CPU2 CM0+ Boot lock enabled
Security disabled
Security enabled

Bit.Name: PCROP1A_STRT
Bit.Description: PCROP1A_STRT[7:0] contain the first included 1kB page readout protected of the Flash area zone A

Bit.Name: PCROP1A_END
Bit.Description: PCROP1A_END[7:0] contain the last included 1kB page readout protected of the Flash area zone A

Values.Val: PCROP zone is kept when RDP is decreased
PCROP zone is erased when RDP is decreased

Bit.Name: WRP1A_STRT
Bit.Description: WRP1A_STRT[6:0] contain the first included 2kB page write protected of the Flash area zone A.

Bit.Name: WRP1A_END
Bit.Description: WRP1A_END[6:0] contain the last included 2kB page write protected of the Flash area zone A.

Bit.Name: WRP1B_STRT
Bit.Description: WRP1B_STRT[6:0] contain the first included 2kB page write protected of the Flash area zone B.

Bit.Name: WRP1B_END
Bit.Description: WRP1B_END[6:0] contain the last included 2kB page write protected of the Flash area zone B.

Bit.Name: PCROP1B_STRT
Bit.Description: PCROP1B_STRT[7:0] contain the first included 1kB page readout protected of the Flash area zone B

Bit.Name: PCROP1B_END
Bit.Description: PCROP1B_END[7:0] contain the last included 1kB page readout protected of the Flash area zone B

Bit.Name: IPCCDBA
Bit.Description: IPCC mailbox data buffer base address

Bit.Name: SFSA
Bit.Description: This bit can only be accessed by software when HDPADIS = 0. When FSD=0: system and Flash secure. SFSA[6:0] contain the start address of the first 2 kB page of the secure Flash area.

Values.Val: System and Flash secure. This bit can only be accessed when HDPADIS = 0
System and Flash non-secure. This bit can only be accessed when HDPADIS = 0
CPU2 debug access enabled (when also enabled by C2SWDBGEN)
CPU2 debug access disabled (when also enabled by C2SWDBGEN)

Bit.Name: HDPSA
Bit.Description: HDPSA[6:0] contain the start address of the first 2 kB page of the User Flash hide protection area. This bit field can only be accessed by software when HDPADIS = 0. When FSD=0 and HDPAD = 0: User Flash hide protection area enabled.

Bit.Name: HDPAD
Bit.Description: User Flash hide protection area disabled. This bit can only be accessed by software when HDPADIS = 0

Values.Val: User Flash hide protection area access enabled.
User Flash hide protection area access disabled.

Bit.Name: SUBGHSPISD
Bit.Description: SPI3 security disable. This bit can only be accessed by software when HDPADIS = 0. FSD=1: SPI3 security is disabled

Values.Val: FSD=0 and SUBGHSPISD=0: SPI3 security enabled
FSD=0 and SUBGHSPISD=1: SPI3 security disabled
SBRV will address SRAM1 or SRAM2, from start address 0x2000 0000 + SBRV.
SBRV will address Flash memory, from start address 0x0800 0000 + SBRV.
SRAM1 is secure if FSD=0 and non-secure otherwise. This bit can only be accessed when HDPADIS = 0
SRAM1 is non-secure if FSD=0 and secure otherwise. This bit can only be accessed when HDPADIS = 0

Bit.Name: SNBRSA
Bit.Description: SNBRSA[4:0] contain the start address of the first 1 kB page of the secure "non-backup" SRAM1 area. To keep the tool working you have to set a value greater or equal to 0xC

Values.Val: SRAM2 is secure if FSD=0 and non-secure otherwise. This bit can only be accessed when HDPADIS = 0
SRAM2 is non-secure if FSD=0 and secure otherwise. This bit can only be accessed when HDPADIS = 0

Bit.Name: SBRSA
Bit.Description: SBRSA[4:0] contain the start address of the first 1 kB page of the secure backup SRAM2 area. To keep the tool working you have to set a value less than 0x15

Bit.Name: SBRV
Bit.Description: SBRV[15:0] contain the word (4B) aligned CPU2 boot reset start address offset within the selected memory area by C2OPT.
